Name: hardwood forestry, eucalyptus ssp., sustainable forest management | sawlog and veneer log, eucalyptus ssp., measured as solid wood under bark | EN15804GD, U
Category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/02:Forestry and logging/022:Logging/0220:Logging
Description: The technological  representativity of this dataset for forestry conditions in Thailand is considered to be low. ;During plantation and growing some fertilizers are used; however, applied quantities are unknown. Trees are harvested mechanically around year 3 at a dbh of 20 centimeters and an average height of 3 meters; 17.5% of tree is loss from delimbing. The production of 228.75 kilograms of log or 3.6 trees needs land of 4.16 m2 per year.;The production practise equals natural growth in sustainable forestry. Natural growth relates to the forest area and CO2 from the atmosphere needed to produce eucalyptus trees.
